snippet: The government said that the American Airlines Group made $425 million by selling takeoff and landing slots at two busy East Coast airports, a figure challenged by the company’s chairman.
abstract: Justice Department says American Airlines Group made $425 million by selling takeoff and landing slots at two busy East Coast airports, as required to win approval for merger that set up company; figure is challenged by company’s chairman.
lead_paragraph: The government said that the American Airlines Group made $425 million by selling takeoff and landing slots at two busy East Coast airports, a figure challenged by the company’s chairman.

headline.main: U.S. and American Airlines Differ on Price for Takeoff Slots
headline.print_headline: U.S. and American Airlines Differ on Price for Takeoff Slots
